string-array.name: tips
string-array.item: Carpool or take transit to work, if possible.
Turn off your car instead of idling for periods longer than 10 seconds.
Schedule regular maintenance checks for your car.
When driving, do many short-distance errands at once so your engine stays warm.
Purchase vehicle fuel mixed with renewable ethanol.
Drive below 90km/hr to maximize fuel efficiency.
Try your best to avoid traffic.
Get your furnace tuned up annually.
Move furniture, rugs and drapes away from air grills and heating vents.
On sunny days, open south facing drapes and let the sun in, a natural source of heat.
Use microwaves or electric heating elements instead of gas elements when heating food.
Hang your laundry to dry instead of using a gas clothes dryer.
Install heavy curtains on windows and glass doors to keep in the heat.
